poem:
Title: "On Reading of Harry Hill"

A spectacle-wearing laugh architect,
who trades scalpel for vaudevillian verse,
rifling gag lines from a standup desk.
Stitched memories of his medical past,
echo in the cadence of his comic jest.
Sixty years of tomfoolery festooned,
Zonked on life, his greatest jest.
A novel, a collection, a birthday show, 
Reflects Harry, the funny doctor we know.
